page.title: 04Blackburn Rovers - a history
page.content: {Blackburn Rovers}were formed in November 1874 and are the 5th oldest club in the football league. The club itself as won the{F.A. Cup}six times, and they won it three times on the run, and became first division champions in 1911, 1912, 1913. In 1960 at Wembley, they were beaten{3:0}by {Wolverhampton Wanderers}in the FA cup final, after being reduced to ten men when David Whelan broke his leg. Substitues were not allowed in those days. Their biggest ever cup victory, was in beating Sheffield Wednesday{8:1}in 1890. They are one of the few clubs to have won{first, {second and third division {championship trophies.}They are still one of the few clubs to still play in their original strip of blue and white halves. { }
